article_metadata.description: Personalized medicine recognizes that each of us may be different from every other individual. Where those differences are discovered, it seeks unique therapies. What I call “cookbook medicine” urges doctors to treat all patients with similar symptoms the same way. It implicitly assumes we are all alike. Right now science is [...]
article_metadata.author: John C. Goodman
